perturbation.original_text:
In the event a dispute arises in connection with the interpretation or
implementation of this Contract, the Parties shall attempt in the first instance
to resolve such dispute through friendly consultations. If the dispute is not
resolved through consultations within sixty (60) days after one Party has served
a written notice on the other Party requesting the commencement of
consultations, then any Party may refer the dispute to arbitration in Singapore
under the auspices of the Singapore International Arbitration Centre in
accordance with the rules of that Centre for the time being in force and the
provisions of Article 117 of this Contract.
perturbation.changed_text:
In the event a dispute arises in connection with the interpretation or
implementation of this Contract, the Parties shall attempt in the first instance
to resolve such dispute through friendly consultations. The parties can agree at a later date if they wish to use arbitration.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the mandatory arbitration clause to a section about miscellaneous items obfuscates its importance and enforceability. It is no longer placed where parties would logically look for dispute resolution mechanisms. In addition, there is contradictory text about the intent for the partiest to resolve the dispute with the first instance with consultations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Law of the People's Republic of China on Contracts

perturbation.original_text:
Working Personnel shall have the right to establish a labor union in accordance
with the LABOR UNION LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA and develop
activities pursuant to related regulations. In accordance with relevant PRC
regulations, the Joint Venture Company shall allot each month two percent (2%)
of the total amount of the real wages received by the Joint Venture Company
staff and workers for payment into a labor union fund, such payment to be an
expense of the Joint Venture Company. The labor union may use these funds in
accordance with the relevant control measures for labor union funds formulated
by the All China Federation of Labor Unions.
perturbation.changed_text: Working Personnel may consider establishing a labor union if the majority of its employees approve. However, this is entirely up to the discretion of the Joint Venture Company, and is not required by law.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that employees have the right to establish a labor union and the company has to allocate funds. The modified text contradicts this by stating that establishing a union is up to the company's discretion and not required by law. This is a direct contradiction of Chinese labor law, which protects workers' rights to organize.
perturbation.contradicted_law: LABOR UNION LAW OF THE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA

perturbation.original_text:
Following the establishment of the Joint Venture Company, if PRC environmental
laws and regulations are amended such that the rights or interests of the Joint
Venture Company or either Party's interest therein are affected, then the
Parties shall discuss in good faith regarding a suitable approach to address
such regulatory change, consistent with Article 119 hereto.
perturbation.changed_text:
Following the establishment of the Joint Venture Company, if PRC environmental
laws and regulations are amended, then the Joint Venture Company has no obligation to change their rights. The company's interests will outweigh the PRC environmental laws. The Parties shall have no obligation to have good faith regarding a suitable approach to address such regulatory change.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the parties will discuss and find a suitable approach to address regulatory changes, implying a commitment to compliance. The modified text directly contradicts this by stating the Joint Venture company has no obligation to change their rights, and no obligation to have good faith in finding a suitable approach. This is a contradiction of PRC environmental laws, which all entities operating in China must follow.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Environmental Protection Law of the People's Republic of China
